xccdf:Benchmark.xccdf:title: XCCDF Benchmark That References the Validation Content for the cmdlet_test
xccdf:Benchmark.xccdf:description: This XCCDF Benchmark references the OVAL Definitions in the validation content for the cmdlet_test.

xccdf:metadata.dc:contributor: National Institute of Standards and Technology
xccdf:metadata.dc:publisher: National Institute of Standards and Technology
xccdf:metadata.dc:creator: National Institute of Standards and Technology

xccdf:Profile.xccdf:title: XCCDF Profile That References the Validation Content for the cmdlet_test
xccdf:Profile.xccdf:description: This Profile allows for the tailoring of the validation content for the cmdlet_test.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Test that the check_existence property is properly supported using ALL_EXIST value.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: Make sure that the value specified, for the check_existence property, is properly supported for the winCmdlet_test.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Test that the check_existence property is properly supported using AT_LEAST_ONE_EXISTS value.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: Make sure that the value specified, for the check_existence property, is properly supported for the winCmdlet_test.

constant_variable.comment: This variable contains the Set cmdlet verb. It needs to be in a variable to bypass schema validation where it checks to see if it is in the enumeration of allowed cmdlet verbs.

This variable contains the regular expression [Gg]et. It needs to be in a variable to bypass schema validation where it checks to see if it is in the enumeration of allowed cmdlet verbs.

metadata.title: Microsoft Windows is installed

criterion.comment: the installed operating system is part of the Microsoft Windows family

family_object.comment: This is the default family object. Only one family object should exist.

notes.note: This CPE Name represents the Windows OS
